result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto Guerrero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence Defendant is serving.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of probation shall remain the same as conditions of Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes:
Any outstanding financials imposed in 15-CM-1042 shall be paid as a condition of probation in 15-CF-451 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not enter establishments where the primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

timeConds.notes: Per order of the Court on 6-07-16, jail sentence amended to 6 months with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roberto Guerrero

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form
Def appears in custody & w/Atty Jeremy Christian Przybyla.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
$2500 cash bond revoked; Defendant held without bond
Sentencing hearing at 01-11-2016 09:30 am

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Jeremy Christian Przybyla.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information w/in 48 hrs; Joint recommendation; On a plea to Ct. 1 State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2 & 3; Guilty plea entered on Ct1, Court accepts plea, finds defendant guilty on Ct. 1, on motion of the State dismisses Ct. 2 & 3 for read in. Defendant admits to 3 prior OWI convictions. States recommendation: withheld sent, 3 years probation consecutive to 15CM1042, 12 month jail with huber as a condition of probation, absolute sobriety, AODA, $4863 fine, $60 blood draw, 36 month IID/DLR.  Due to complexity and time constraints Court adjourns sentencing. Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
